definitions.text: sloping land (especially the slope beside a body of water)
examples: they pulled the canoe up on the bank
he sat on the bank of the river and watched the currents

definitions.text: a financial institution that accepts deposits and channels the money into lending activities
examples: he cashed a check at the bank
that bank holds the mortgage on my home

definitions.text: an arrangement of similar objects in a row or in tiers
examples: he operated a bank of switches

definitions.text: a supply or stock held in reserve for future use (especially in emergencies)
the funds held by a gambling house or the dealer in some gambling games
examples: he tried to break the bank at Monte Carlo

definitions.text: a slope in the turn of a road or track; the outside is higher than the inside in order to reduce the effects of centrifugal force
a container (usually with a slot in the top) for keeping money at home
a building in which the business of banking transacted
examples: the bank is on the corner of Nassau and Witherspoon

definitions.text: a flight maneuver; aircraft tips laterally about its longitudinal axis (especially in turning)
examples: the plane went into a steep bank
the pilot had to bank the aircraft

definitions.text: do business with a bank or keep an account at a bank
examples: Where do you bank in this town?

definitions.text: act as the banker in a game or in gambling

examples: She deposits her paycheck every month

definitions.text: cover with ashes so to control the rate of burning

examples: I swear by my grandmother's recipes
